page.title: 11POWER SUPPLIES
page.content: Every house has piped mains water and is supplied with mains electricity from overhead power lines. There is no piped gas but some people use Calor (bottled) gas for cooking and heating, or even full central heating. .there is a small sewage works which services thecouncil estate and a few private houses nearby, but most houses have a cesspit or (more commonly) a septic tank which allows clean water to drain away. There is no real mains drainage. Many houses burn solid fuel in their grates, but supplement the heating with electric fires in the bedrooms etc. .some people have solid fuel central heating systems, others have an oil_fired boiler and others again have electric storage heaters. There is no street lighting. The TV system needs roof aerials. Refuse is collected every week. Most have phone
